required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Intervention Comparative Effectiveness for Adult Cognitive Training
clinical_study.official_title: Intervention Comparative Effectiveness for Adult Cognitive Training

brief_summary.textblock: The study will compare the effect of broad and directed (narrow) technology-based training on basic perceptual and cognitive abilities in older adults and on the performance of simulated tasks of daily living including driving and fraud avoidance.

detailed_description.textblock: Participants will be randomly assigned to four training conditions: broad training using either 1) Posit Science's web-based "BrainHQ" or 2) the video game Rise of Nations, or to directed training for 3) Instrumental Activities of Daily Living (IADL) training on both driving, American Association of Retired Persons (AARP)'s web-based older driver training program, and training for fraud avoidance, a web-based tutorial on finance and fraud, or 4) to an active control condition of puzzle solving. Training will take approximately 15-20 hr for each treatment condition. Before training begins, participants will take baseline ability tests of perception, attention, memory, and cognition, activities of daily living, as well as a driving simulator test for hazard perception, and a financial fraud recognition test. They will be tested again on these measures following training completion, and at a one-year follow-up from training completion.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Random assignment to one of four treatment groups at study entry
study_design_info.masking_description: Assessors will be blinded to study condition when administering the tests to participants

primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in accuracy in discriminating fraud from non-fraud text-based scenarios (using 3 parallel forms)

primary_outcome.measure: Driving Simulator Hazard Perception post training
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in accuracy of navigation within driving scenarios in the DriveSafety simulator (using 3 parallel forms)
Change from baseline in Self-reported difficulties in completing instrumental activities of daily living
Change from Baseline in the Latent variable of Speed of processing composed by averaging z-scores from the Useful Field of View (UFOV) test and Digit Symbol Substitution Test
Test questions based on the AARP driving course

primary_outcome.measure: Knowledge about Finances and Fraud post training
primary_outcome.description: Test questions based on the Finance and Fraud training tutorial
Change from baseline in accuracy in discriminating fraud from non-fraud text-based scenarios (using 3 parallel forms)

primary_outcome.measure: Driving Simulator Hazard Perception at one year
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in accuracy of navigation within driving scenarios in the DriveSafety simulator (using 3 parallel forms)

primary_outcome.measure: Self-reported IADL task at one year
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in Self-reported difficulties in completing instrumental activities of daily living

primary_outcome.measure: Speed of Processing at one year
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the Latent variable composed by averaging z-scores from the Useful Field of View (UFOV) test and Digit Symbol Substitution Test

primary_outcome.measure: Knowledge about driving at one year
primary_outcome.description: Test questions based on the AARP driving course

primary_outcome.measure: Knowledge about Finances and Fraud at one year
primary_outcome.description: Test questions based on the Finance and Fraud training tutorial

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Technology Proficiency post training
secondary_outcome.description: Latent variable composed by averaging z-scores from the Computer Proficiency Questionnaire and the Mobile Device Proficiency Questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Technology Proficiency at one year
secondary_outcome.description: Latent variable composed by averaging z-scores from the Computer Proficiency Questionnaire and the Mobile Device Proficiency Questionnaire
Score on the Berlin Numeracy Test

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Numeracy at one year
secondary_outcome.description: Score on the Berlin Numeracy Test

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Reasoning Ability post training
secondary_outcome.description: Latent variable composed by averaging z-scores from Raven's Advanced Progressive Matrices and Letter Sets

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Reasoning Ability at one year
secondary_outcome.description: Latent variable composed by averaging z-scores from Raven's Advanced Progressive Matrices and Letter Sets

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Memory Ability post training
secondary_outcome.description: Latent variable composed by averaging z-scores from Hopkins Verbal Learning and Rey Auditory Verbal Learning Test

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Memory Ability at one year
secondary_outcome.description: Latent variable composed by averaging z-scores from Hopkins Verbal Learning and Rey Auditory Verbal Learning Test

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Miami IADL task post training
secondary_outcome.description: Score on Miami IADL task based on number of correct tasks/time completed

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Miami IADL task at one year
secondary_outcome.description: Score on Miami IADL task based on number of correct tasks/time completed

arm_group.description: Participants will be provided with a laptop computer and enrolled in a commercial web-based cognitive training program, BrainHQ, trained on how to access it, and instructed to complete a fixed number of sessions in 20 hours.
Participants will be provided with a laptop computer with the Rise of Nations video game, be trained in game play, and instructed to play the game for 20 hours

Participants will be enrolled in AARP's web-based driver training course, trained on how to access it, and asked to complete the course, estimated to take approximately 6-8 hours. They will also be provided with web-based access to a finance and fraud avoidance training tutorial, instructed on how to access it, and be asked to complete the course, estimated to take approximately 5-7 hours. The two courses combined are estimated to take about 15 hours.
Participants will be provided with a laptop computer and asked to complete 20 hr of training with Sudoku, crossword puzzles, and word search

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 65 years and above
- Plans to stay in the Tallahassee, Leon County area for the next year
- Valid driver's license and drives at least once a month
- Adequate cognitive ability assessed via telephone interview using the Wechsler Memory Scale III with story A score >6 or story B score >4.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Terminal illness with life expectancy less than 12 months
- Reports or exhibits a disabling visual condition assessed as the inability to read printed material
- Reports or exhibits a disabling speech hearing and comprehension condition assessed by inability to hear and comprehend the screener's instructions
- Reports or exhibits a disabling speech production condition assessed as the inability to respond with comprehensible English speech to the screener's queries
- Reports or exhibits a disabling psychomotor condition assessed as the inability to use a keyboard and pointing device
- Has completed the AARP driver training course
- Has played the Rise of Nations video game
- Has trained with Posit Science's "BrainHQ"
- Has trained on the Mind Frontiers video game.

study_doc.doc_comment: Open Science Foundation registration of Data Analysis Plan
